title: Print, "The Lute Player and the Singer (2nd state)", before 1500
medium: Engraving with black ink on off-white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed on margin below, in the center: "I.M."
provenance: From the Collection of Leo Wallerstein
description: A young man, seated on the right, accompanies on his lute a young lady seated beside him who sings.  A dog is seen chained near the man.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "The Lute Player and the Singer (2nd state)", before 1500.
before 1500. Engraving with black ink on off-white laid paper. Gift of Mrs. Leo Wallerstein. 1959-72-2.
